intro: Calocapnos, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It consists of several species that are typically found in rocky or arid environments, often growing in crevices or on slopes. The plants are characterized by their small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink or purple. They have basal leaves that are often lobed or divided, and their stems are usually hairy. Calocapnos species are generally herbaceous and can be found in various parts of Europe, Asia, and North America.
